## This is a sample GOV form ## 

This form introduces the key components and features.  2

Use the Editor view to understand how it has been built and feel free to make changes and base your own forms on this one.
This can be used for general page content.
This can be used to draw attention to important information on the page
This can be used to make the page easier to scan by only showing contextual information when required. Click on the 'Help with nationality' to see how this works.

fields.label: Help with nationality.
fields.infoText: If you're not sure about your nationality, try to find out from an official document like a passport or national ID card. We need to know your nationality so we can work out which elections you're entitled to vote in. If you can't provide your nationality, you'll have to send copies of identity documents through the post.
The exclamation icon can be used with bold text to warn people about something important, for example if there are legal consequences like a fine.

fields.label: Text box
fields.helpText: This is the default text field. It is set to mandatory and will only accept 0-9, Aa-Zz and '-.

fields.label: Text box including special characters
fields.helpText: This text field is set to mandatory and allows special characters to be entered without restriction

fields.label: Limited character text box
fields.helpText: This text field is set to mandatory and limits input to a maximum of 10 characters including spaces. The user cannot continue if they enter more than 10 characters

fields.label: Optional text box
fields.helpText: This text field can be left blank and does not require any input to enable the user to continue.

fields.infoText: Hint text sits above a form field and provides supporting contextual help.
The type of text field used to provide contact details can be set to meet the needs of the form owner. For example whether a field is optional or mandatory.

fields.label: Email address
fields.helpText: Enter a valid email address with no spaces. e.g name@example.com
fields.errorMessage: Enter a valid email address with no spaces. e.g name@example.com

fields.label: Positive whole number text box
fields.helpText: This field only accepts positive whole numbers and is limited to 11 digits. If a user enters a negative value or a decimal place, they will receive an error message.

fields.label: Sterling box
fields.helpText: This is formatted to receive values in Sterling, including pounds and pence and is also limited to 11 digits. Negative values can be entered by using a minus(-) symbol. Commas can be used to display larger numbers.

fields.infoText: gForms are able to perform calculations using values entered on the same or previous pages. The following examples demonstrate the addition and multiplication expressions.

fields.infoText: This is a standard date component frequently used to declare the start and end dates of a return period.

fields.label: Start/end date
fields.errorMessage: Enter the return period start date using the correct format

fields.label: End date
fields.helpText: There is some validation on this field, which prevents users submitting an end date prior to the start date
fields.errorMessage: Enter the end date as a period later than the start date

fields.infoText: Date entries can be customised based on requirements, such as limiting them by number of days, months and years.
This is the file upload feature. Accepted file types include: documents, spreadsheets, PowerPoint presentations, images, and PDFs.
